intro: Bulbostylis densa subsp. densa, commonly known as the dense spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescences and narrow, grass-like leaves. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in tight, cylindrical spikes. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
